page.title: 03Amesbury Sports Centre
page.content: The Sports Centre was opened in 1974. It was provided by Wiltshire County Council and the former Amesbury Town Council at a cost of Â£170,000.The two squash courts which were added in 1981 cost Â£70,000 and were paid for by profits from the sports centre. It is equipped for the playing of volley ball, basketball, netball, badminton and five-a-side football. There are also weight training facilities. There is a school term time playgroup and an evening youth club and recently introduced Sunday roller skating. The club has now purchased its own roller skates as the firm which originally hired out the skates charged so much rental that the scheme was not profitable. Now after an outlay of Â£1,500 on skates it is a successful addition to the facilities.
